urls.title: Horror at destruction of nationally important UK river | The Wildlife Trusts
urls.description: Major damage to River Lugg in Herefordshire will be test case for Government commitment to strengthen wildlife protection.

tweets.text:
A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

A mile of the River Lugg has been bulldozed to destruction.
Bankside trees grubbed out & burnt.
Riverbed scraped out.
Meanders reprofiled.
Disaster for downstream wildlife.
This was an SSSI.
No consent was sought. 
@EnvAgency must surely prosecute this.
RT
https://t.co/cSBhrR2nDW

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Did you know about this on 26th November as reported by the Guardian? In which case why has it taken 9 days to act in he face of such devastation?

domain.name: Brand
domain.description: Brands and Companies

tweets.text: @Freedomofdoubt @DaveThroupEA @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil https://t.co/kvgJG05slR

Expecting to hear a lot more from @EnvAgency about this bit. A lot more. Seems like most of the damage to the Lugg could have been prevented if EA had Actually. Done. Anything. when the initial report was made, rather than 8 days later.

https://t.co/TFpElReUQZ https://t.co/C90bL64rRM

@herefordhubbard @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil I thought that too! After a hefty fine and repair of damage, a lifelong pledge to care for and maintain a family of beavers on the Lugg

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil They should be made to accept beavers on their land with large scale tree planting - won‚Äôt take a couple of beavers long to sort out the devastation & provide numerous habitats for other wildlife. #beavers

@GeoffDa84684078 @manereblog @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Yes. The Lugg floods. We have evidence of this going back 4000 years, to the beginnings of agriculture in the area. Whats your point?

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil More of this please.  Far too much of this is just not pursued.  There must be clear consequences for this desecration of what‚Äôs left of the natural environment.  It is precious and must be fought for.

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Now a prosecution needs to follow _and a proper, meaningful one - not some weedly fine or slap on the wrist. This is intentional, wilful, murderous, destruction and the penalty should reflect that. I am so sick of some landowners feeling they are above the law.

@DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Well done - EA Drone operator surveying damage at River Lugg at Kingsland site this afternoon - picture editors more at Alamy Live News @guardian @guardianphotos #riverlugg @TelegraphPics https://t.co/SBFVor1VIu

domain.name: Brand
domain.description: Brands and Companies

tweets.text: @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Please take action on this. Send a message to others that they will not be able to get away with it. Just slapping a fine on a rich landowner will not make a dent. We're depending on you, so please do this properly, publically and to the full extent of the law.

We‚Äôve used our powers of entry at the River Lugg #Herefordshire incident

14 specialist officers from @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil now on site gathering information & evidence. https://t.co/LLCOFQHCox

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency I could believe that the EA did have some prior knowledge/discussion with the local PC. Obviously poor communication all round. What's done is done now, but they now need to let a professional outfit sort whatever the problem was originally & try & recover the SSI as much as poss

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency If it‚Äôs for flood prevention why did they not haul in rubble and build raised banking back from the river bank ü§∑üèª‚Äç‚ôÇÔ∏è

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency My hunch is that the EA are going to come out of this badly.

Curiouser and curiouser.

https://t.co/cxiwV3YF4M

@FHawksworth @ShropshireCraft @1Finches @geoffshumba @RslewisSally @Jennife10651535 @CallMeMoNow @charbhardy @woolhatwoman @McminnSandeep @NethertonNews @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil The trouble with HS2 is that it‚Äôs state-sponsored destruction. And it‚Äôs going through the most untouched bits, presumably to reduce compensation costs. The carnage is horrific üò°

@AdamWelz @RobGMacfarlane @Jamie_Woodward_ @EnvAgency ah. John Price https://t.co/AhkRgmzt3k
We're taking reports of environmental damage to the #SSSI at the #RiverLugg very seriously, and are working with @EnvAgency and @ForestryComm to take immediate action. https://t.co/27DINp3vD7
@duxkuk @GeoffDa84684078 @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil Whose?

BEFORE & AFTER

Appalling #EcoVandalism at The #RiverLugg SSSI #Herefordshire

THIS IS ILLEGAL ACTIVITY

The @WildlifeTrusts will be making sure appropriate legal action is taken https://t.co/U8lt4ZuX1t

@Fleurfox @ecology_digest @sarahhenshall @Buzz_dont_tweet @NaturalEngland @incendiarypig @EnvAgency @CarolineLucas @KerryMP P. S. Important to try and understand the full picture though. Enough conjecture from me I think.

@Feargal_Sharkey @EnvAgency Prison and a huge fine. 
The culprits need to be made an example of. Nothing less will suffice.

Curiouser and curiouser.

The redoubtable @bettwsresident CEO of @WUFoundation making it very clear  that @EnvAgencyMids were alerted to the destruction that was taking place on the River Lugg last week. 

Did EA the respond? If not why not.

Starts 8:37

https://t.co/XbNCDTpqIL
@DanielMacKenzi6 @GeoffDa84684078 @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil See his other account and disengage!

@CraigBennett3 @JohnSensible @NaturalEngland @EnvAgency @DefraGovUK @WildlifeTrusts A blind man could even tell you  its not the same location. Had that been the same location any operator on a digger would have used any stone he came across to shore up the bank to prevent any slippage.  There looks to be stone on the water edge on left hand photo.
@iojikLeigh @RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency Agreed!

That‚Äôs why we‚Äôre putting ¬£1.4 million towards funding 15 community projects to plant more trees near rivers and streams.

urls.title: Cumbria | The Flood Hub
urls.description: This local spaces area will provide information o n our aim to manage flood risk on a catchment scale from Source to Sea. In this section we will introduce you to Cumbria Strategic Flood Partnership, a collective of organisations that coordinates all flood risk management planning and delivery and detailed information on Flood Risk Management Schemes being delivered.

tweets.text:
In 2015 Storm Desmond hit Cumbria flooding many areas including the town of #Egremont. 
 
5 years on and #TeamEA are investing 12 million on a flood scheme for the town with works ongoing to better protect 220 properties from flooding. 
 
For more info - https://t.co/UibqT7Itw6 https://t.co/kDcqp2sM3E

Take your knowledge further with a Flood and Coastal Engineering MSc. 

Scholarships are available, full time for one year starting in September 2021 and will include a 3 month work placement at the @EnvAgency (subject to terms and conditions).

Apply now: https://t.co/cStzUAbhhi https://t.co/eoVU9cFApj

#Flooding affects millions worldwide and the future needs more engineers. 

Join @BrunelUni and @EnvAgency on Friday 11 Dec 10am BST to hear what it‚Äôs like to study a sponsored degree in Flood and Coastal Engineering and ask questions.  

Register now: https://t.co/SCyzVeQUb8 https://t.co/NucZHyZQvi

@GeoffDa84684078 @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil So maintain the fences or plant effective hedges. Himalayan balsom, I agree, is a menace but I'm not clear why its relevant here.

@CKirbyLambert @ecology_digest @sarahhenshall @Buzz_dont_tweet @NaturalEngland @incendiarypig @EnvAgency @CarolineLucas @KerryMP Council minutes from July onwards show consultations with EA regarding the river (Balfour Beatty to be consulted flood work at bridge 3rd arch). Looks more likely now rogue farmer. Minutes freely available on website menu https://t.co/9H6szDXtfw

tweets.text:
@RobGMacfarlane @EnvAgency In defence of the local farmer, but parts of the River Lugg in Herefordshire have been flooded almost continuously.
#r4today https://t.co/KQBVdXPNXC

@hertsessexbirds @Ministryofspeak @DaveThroupEA @EnvAgency @NaturalEngland @ForestryComm @WMerciaPolice @HfdsCouncil I doubt they don't have the resources to send one person down there to have a look same issue as Talgarth when they didn't respond

We're mounting a wide-ranging investigation into reports of damage to the #RiverLugg, which is protected through SSSI status. We're treating this very seriously, working with @NaturalEngland & @ForestryComm who have taken immediate action to prevent any further works at the site. https://t.co/bvhnTETfal

The Field Team is still out clearing up after Storm Alex at the weekend. 

Today they‚Äôve removed trees from the tree catchers at Morpeth. 

Catching trees here prevents them from blocking bridges and restricting flow in the town, reducing flood risk. 

#StormAlex 
#Flood https://t.co/He64nZT3ND
